intro.description: I design modern, responsive, and intuitive interfaces, combining accessibility, usability, and advanced web technologies.

about_me: Originally from Calvisano (Brescia), I have over 7 years of experience in the retail industry, including 5 years as a store manager and 2 years in sales, developing skills in leadership, B2B/B2C customer management, and organization. In 2023, I decided to pursue web development and completed a front-end developer course at 24Ore Business School, with expertise in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, TypeScript, Angular, and Ionic. I now reside in the province of Monza, ready to take on new challenges in the field of web development.

experience.freelance: Since october 2024, I have been working as a freelance frontend developer, specializing in Angular and PWA. I focus on creating modern and high-performance interfaces, while expanding my skills in backend, hosting, and deployment to provide complete solutions to my clients. At the same time, I develop open-source applications to experiment with new technologies and contribute to the tech community. I am also exploring mobile development, aiming to create PWAs. If you’re looking for a passionate and continuously growing frontend developer, feel free to contact me for collaborations or innovative projects!
experience.moi_2024: Contributed to the development of a web application by improving its logic and user interface. Designed a new interface for managing delivery notes, integrated back-end APIs, implemented the Dynamsoft SDK for document scanning, and used AG Grid for dynamic tables. The work was carried out in a Docker environment.
experience.more_sales: Managed client acquisition and maintained relationships with existing customers. Prepared and updated sales price lists, achieved sales targets, and supported back-office activities.
experience.more_store_manager: Managed the setup and operation of two MoreCover stores at La Rinascente in Milan and Rome. Supervised two teams of 4 members, handling recruitment, selection, training, and onboarding of new employees. Achieved sales KPIs and ensured UV printer maintenance.

money-changer.description: Money Changer is a project I worked on from March 2024 to October 2024 at Moi Studio. It involves the redesign of an existing web app, with the goal of creating a new user interface, while the backend team worked on updating the internal functionalities. In parallel, a twin app was developed for managing bureaucratic procedures. Money Changer is a project I worked on from March 2024 to October 2024 at Moi Studio. It involves the redesign of an existing web app, with the goal of creating a new user interface, while the backend team worked on updating the internal functionalities. In parallel, a twin app was developed for managing bureaucratic procedures.
money-changer.new_interface: My main contribution was designing a new user interface for cash withdrawal management. Using Figma, I developed a modern and intuitive design that simplifies the workflow for the end user.
money-changer.techs: AG Grid: I integrated highly performant and customizable tables, designed to meet industrial-level needs. Dynamsoft's Dynamic Web TWAIN SDK: This browser-based SDK allows for the development of robust document scanning applications on all major browsers. It is designed to ensure speed, security, and scalability with just a few lines of JavaScript code. The project was executed in a containerized environment using Docker, ensuring that all components function optimally. To achieve this, I learned how to use Docker Desktop.

features.1: Quick and efficient document scanning: The app allows for simple and secure document scanning, saving the data in a solid and reliable database.
features.2: Advanced data management: Customizable tables enable users with elevated privileges to manage and organize data with extreme precision.
features.3: Currency exchange transaction management: The app provides a user-friendly experience for managing transactions quickly and efficiently, ensuring maximum security to prevent errors and protect customers.

money-changer.conclusion: The project was developed in an Agile context, with close collaboration between the development and design teams to ensure a functional and high-quality end product.

money-tracker.description: Money Tracker is a mobile application designed to help you manage your finances in a simple and effective way. The project was born out of my personal need to better organize daily expenses. After testing and studying various existing applications on the market, I drew inspiration from their main features to create an app that fully meets my personal needs and offers an enhanced user experience.
money-tracker.techs: The technology used for Money Tracker includes the Ionic framework with Capacitor for cross-platform development and Chart.js for displaying data in intuitive and easy-to-understand charts.

features.1: Expense tracking: You can record your expenses and categorize them in an organized way, to always have a clear overview of your finances.
features.2: Data visualization: Expenses are represented through simple and interactive charts, to allow for quick and accurate analysis.
features.3: Family group management: With a login-based authentication system, you can create shared groups to monitor family expenses. This functionality includes:

subfeatures.sub3.2: Management of debts between members, with automatic calculations to balance accounts.

money-tracker.conclusion: The purpose of Money Tracker is to simplify both individual and shared financial management, making it accessible and visually understandable for everyone.

task-manager.description: A Todo component integrated into my personal portfolio, developed with Angular 18 and NgRx to demonstrate advanced state management skills. The goal was to create a modern, reactive interface showcasing seamless integration between UI components and state management.
task-manager.new_interface: I designed a glassmorphism interface that blends perfectly with the portfolio's color palette, with a mobile-first usability focus. Transition animations and visual feedback for actions were optimized for a fluid user experience.
task-manager.techs: Angular 18: Leveraging new features like control flow. NgRx: Implemented with store, actions, and reducers for scalable state management. RxJS: For reactivity and observable handling. SCSS: Using CSS variables for perfect integration with the existing palette.

features.1: Centralized state architecture: All CRUD operations flow through the NgRx store, demonstrating best practices for complex applications.
features.2: Inline editing: Allows modifying task text directly in the component with blur-triggered autosave.
features.3: Smart filtering: Implemented through memoized selectors to maximize performance.
features.4: Persistence layer: Easily extendable to save state to localStorage or backend.

subfeatures.sub4.3: Pure reducers with immutable state management
subfeatures.sub4.4: Efficient selectors for deriving complex data

task-manager.conclusion: This component demonstrates how NgRx can simplify state management even in medium-sized projects, offering powerful debugging tools (Redux DevTools) and a solid foundation for future extensions. The Angular 18 integration showcases a modern approach to reactive programming.
